ygData.subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
ygData.msgSnippet: ... She looked at Iron Raptor.  In a timid voice, You will send others with me to retrieve your friend?  She looked down and thought about this.  She would

::Feline:;

She looked at Iron Raptor.  In a timid voice,"You will send others 
with me to retrieve your friend?"  She looked down and thought about 
this.  She would have the protection she would need incase of 
trouble.  And the other bots would help with the bots if they were 
found in stasis lock.

She looked back up at Iron Raptor, "If he isn't in stasis, he won't 
attack will he?"  She stayed still and looked at the holoprojector.
She saw Dinobot as a big male and a possable threat to her.

She turned and looked at Prowl and shrank back in her seat.  She 
wrapped her tail around her waist and looked down.  

"I'll go and do as you wish.  I'll go and bring back your friends."  
She shook a little in her seat.  "Who...who will you send me with?"
still showing fear and uneasiness.




--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> 
> * Iron Raptor didn't like the way this was going at the moment, too 
much 
> fear and uncertenty un the room.
> But at least it seemed as if Feline had relaxed a bit...until Iron 
Raptor 
> mentioned the rearch mission.
> Feline had walked towards the holo-projector and looked at the 
imaged 
> desplayed on it, basically of both of the bots whos signatures had 
stopped 
> in Grid 16.
> It was a little hard not to notice that the fembot almost seemed to 
show a 
> little fear towards one of the projections in particular, the 
biggest and 
> most deadly of the two. Dinobot.
> Iron Raptor sighed and rubbed the back of her head for a moment.
> Now, THERE was a bot with an attetude that could cause Feline a few 
> problems.
> He was big, powerful and mean. Three things that Feline might not 
be able to 
> handle. And if she was lucky, she might get a full sentance out of 
him that 
> doesn't end with a threat.
> Iron Raptor sighed again. But he was dependable and vary loyal. She 
guessed 
> that for those his attetude was worth putting up with.
> But it was then that Feline seemed to regain her fear again at the 
mention 
> of the Alliance, something that could also become a prob.
> Iron Raptor watched Feline sit and shake a bit, walking over to the 
table 
> and sitting on it beside her.*
> 
> " I wasn't planning to send you out alone. That would just be 
stupid to 
> start with. You'd have a pertner or two, whatever was needed. If 
Dinobot's 
> in stasis lock you'll need two bots to carry him alone."
> 
> * She then looked at the holo-image of the Transmetal 2.*
> 
> " And the Alliance isn't what you have to worry about, they're too 
far away 
> to even bother with you once you got there. Dinobot's your main 
problem if 
> he's still online."
> 
> * Iron Raptor steadied her seat on the table and crossed her legs, 
getting a 
> little more comfortable. Motioning for Prowl to come over there 
with them so 
> that he didn't seem so alien to Feline any longer.
> She then looked at Feline agains to see her reaction, then back at 
the 
> projaction.*
> 
> " I can tell you right now, he'll reject any help and you'll 
probably be met 
> with a pair of Transmetal 2 jaws since he doesn't know you. And I 
can bet my 
> position as command that he won't trust you right off the back 
either."
> 
> * Iron Raptor then smiled down at Feline.*
> 
> " But I can garontee one thing, treat him with respect and he'll do 
the same 
> for you." * she then chuckled.* " How else do you think I manage to 
live 
> with him?"
> 
> * She then looked at the projection and then back at Feline.*
> 
> " But I'll send a few bots with you for protection, just in case. 
Also to 
> carry a bit of equipment, knowing that Dinobot will definitly be 
> damaged...you'll need it."
> 
> * Iron Raptor then leaned back on her hands and looked up at the 
cieling, 
> trying to think quickly of just who she could send with Feline.
> A thoughtful growl sounded from her throat as her mind worked, but 
the truth 
> was...she didn't know just who was free and willing to do it. She 
mostly had 
> to think of a few bots that could handle Dinobot'd aggression and 
not snapp 
> back at him in return, that would only make things worse. 
Especially if he 
> was injured.
> Iron Raptor then looked over at Prowl, a little expression on her 
face 
> saying that she couldn't really think of any.*
> 
> " Prowl? Any...suggentions of who we can send with Feline."
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
